intro: Tragia jonesii, commonly known as Jones' tragia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and branched stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are typically ovate or lanceolate, with a rough texture. Tragia jonesii is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
